did you get it in a run-time workbench or in your normal workbench?

hm, looking at the code, it seems that the change to the exit strategy causes
some events to come in in a different order. We may now get a disconnect when
already left.

The solution is to check for the active state in disconnect().

Patch is ready for M2.

Verified in code in I200409212000: the bug now prevents disconnect() code to be
run in cases where it should.

instead of the wrong check for fIsActive, I will add a simple null-check to
avoid the NPE. 

fixed > 20040922
